content.question: Reaction <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext=" O plus O produces O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> Reaction <math alttext="B " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext="C 2 H 4 plus C 2 H 4 produces C 4 H 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> Reaction <math alttext="C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext="C O plus O 2 produces C O 2 plus O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Reaction <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: <math alttext="C H 3 I plus B r with a negative 1 charge produces C H 3 B r plus I with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>Br</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> The equations shown above represent four elementary reactions. Which of the following identifies the reaction in which the number of successful collisions and reaction rate are independent of the orientation of the reactants and explains why?

choices.label: Reaction <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the electron clouds of the <math alttext="O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are distributed symmetrically.

Reaction <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because each <math alttext="C 2 H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule has a double bond.

Reaction <math alttext="C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both <math alttext="C O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are linear molecules.

Reaction <math alttext="D " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the reactant <math alttext="B r with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the product <math alttext="I with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are negatively charged.

content.answer: Reaction <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the electron clouds of the <math alttext="O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are distributed symmetrically.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
